articles.author: Ross McLeish
articles.description: Leagues around the world, including the Scottish Premiership, could be given the green light to trial referees making in-stadium announcements to explain decisions after VAR reviews before the end of the year, but broadcasting live discussions on decisions appears less likely, The Scotsman has learned.
articles.title: In-stadium announcements on VAR rulings could be approved in leagues by year-end

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Celtic Women will play their final game of the SWPL season at Celtic Park after the club decided to switch the venue for what could be a title celebration.
articles.title: Celtic switch title decider venue and look to create another record

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Neil Lennon believes Ange Postecoglou will look to “add a bit of physicality” to his Celtic side ahead for their Champions League campaign next season.
articles.title: How Ange Postecoglou will strengthen Celtic for Champions League as Neil Lennon in 'few will be leaving' claim

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: While there are three rounds of the Scottish Premiership remaining, plus the Scottish Cup final where Celtic will be aiming to complete a treble, there is a fascination about the summer transfer window with a number of clubs set for a rebuild or significant tweaks to their squad.
articles.title: Scottish transfers: Rangers star 'agreement' with giants, Celtic eye 6ft5in defender, Beale target boost, Hearts ace deal admission

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: St Johnstone loan star Adam Montgomery and Motherwell’s emerging teenage ace Max Johnston have been nominated for the Scottish Football Writers’ Association’s SPFL Young Player of the Year award.
articles.title: The 4 SFWA Scottish Young Player of the Year nominees - including Celtic loan star and Euro-linked Well ace

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: It was Jota’s strike against Rangers in the first Old Firm clash of the season which won Celtic’s – and PFA Scotland’s – goal of the season award. But if there was a goal which was pure Celtic, which truly summed up the campaign for Ange Postecoglou’s treble-chasing league champions it is Kyogo Furuhashi’s strike against Hearts at Tynecastle Park last weekend.
articles.title: Kyogo Furuhashi, Celtic and summer 'dilemma' - Euro interest, deserved award haul, incredible goal stats

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: It is a rebirth for the nation. It is no stretch to suggest that the delirium generated within Billy Gilmour’s Scottish homeland two years ago over his long-predicted emergence assumed astronomical proportions.
articles.title: Smokin' hot Billy Gilmour - Scottish tall tales and what recent Brighton rebirth means for Rangers and Celtic chat and national team

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: It is a rebirth for the nation. It is no stretch to suggest that the delirium generated within Billy Gilmour’s Scottish homeland two years ago over his long-predicted emergence assumed astronomical proportions.
articles.title: Smokin' hot Billy Gilmour - Scottish tall tales and what recent Brighton birth means for Rangers and Celtic chat and national team

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Aberdeen have decided against entering a ‘B’ team into a proposed new Scottish Conference League.
articles.title: Why Aberdeen are not following Rangers, Celtic and Hearts in B team plan

articles.author: Ross McLeish
articles.description: Former Celtic forward Kris Commons has urged the club to strengthen defensively in the wake of losing the final Old Firm derby 3-0 to Rangers.
articles.title: Celtic urged to reinforce in wake of Rangers loss as one player singled out as 'disappointment'

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou and his free-scoring forward Kyogo Furuhashi picked the main gongs at the PFA Scotland award ceremony on Sunday evening.
articles.title: Celtic hoover up main awards with four gongs, Rangers land two - full list of PFA winners

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: In a season of severe disappointment for Rangers, what happened over the weekend can at least give some optimism for the 2023/24 campaign.
articles.title: Rangers-Celtic final word: The magnificent Cantwell, Postecoglou's deputies show weakness, Morelos and Lovelace

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: The SWPL title race will go down to the final round of fixtures next weekend with Glasgow City holding the advantage after a 2-1 victory over Partick Thistle.
articles.title: SWPL title race goes to gripping final day - Glasgow City hold slender advantage over Rangers and Celtic

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Ange Postecoglou is a “good enough” manager for the Premier League and will want to manage in the English top-flight, according to Pat Nevin.
articles.title: 'A team like Leeds' - Ange Postecoglou Premier League job claim as pundit expresses Celtic hope

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Celtic defender Cameron Carter-Vickers has not a put a timeline on his return to first-team action after having knee surgery but says he is feeling “positive” about his recovery.
articles.title: Cameron Carter-Vickers gives update on knee surgery but no date set for Celtic return

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: It felt as if a collective weight was lifted off Rangers as a club courtesy of Michael Beale’s men conjuring up a zestful 3-0 slapdown of their Celtic rivals. It certainly provided respite for the Ibrox manager, and food for thought.
articles.title: Rangers-Celtic reaction: Beale will mount title challenge; Pope pilloried; Barbour’s bizarre Sky take

articles.author: Graeme Macpherson
articles.description: Charlie Reilly is the poster boy for the power of perseverance. Rubbing shoulders the other day with a clutch of Celtic players and Motherwell striker Kevin van Veen as one of the nominees for the PFA Scotland awards, the Albion Rovers forward looked as incongruous as a penguin in the Sahara.
articles.title: Meet the Albion Rovers youngster keeping company with Celtic and Rangers

articles.author: Graham Bean
articles.description: Gregor Townsend went into this season’s Six Nations thinking it was going to be his last in charge of Scotland, and France was a realistic option for the coach before he put pen to paper on a new deal at Murrayfield.
articles.title: Scotland boss opens up on approach from French club and Ange Postecoglou Celtic talks

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: It was the day Michael Beale, whatever any public he may have made, will have craved for more than five months.
articles.title: Rangers finally have their day: Ravenous Ibrox crowd devours win as Celtic resemble old bouquet of flowers

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou declared the most egregious element of his side’s 3-0 loss to Rangers was that they seemed to give up in the encounter in the second period.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou makes stark Celtic admission after Rangers loss, comments on Oh and tells new boys 'you don't get an easy ride'

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Rangers and Celtic meet for the final time in the 2022/23 campaign at Ibrox, with the newly-crowned Premiership champions looking to go a whole season undefeated against their Glasgow rivals.
articles.title: Old Firm late team news: Rangers to make huge call at both ends of pitch, Celtic's major boost, probable XIs

articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: Living in the moment, the primary concern for Celtic is Saturday afternoon’s trip to Ibrox. That’s where more bragging rights and the opportunity to navigate the season unbeaten by their Glasgow rivals is at stake.
articles.title: 'When you rhyme off those milestones ...' - Callum McGregor explains what underpins his Celtic success

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Little could be more telling as to the trajectory of Alfredo Morelos’ Rangers career than what could await him when Celtic are hosted at Ibrox come Saturday lunchtime.
articles.title: The Ballad of Alfie: Closing refrains are melancholy - Rangers legacy, Beale's view, Celtic clashes

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Rangers midfielder Todd Cantwell has certainly been a man making headlines since his January transfer window arrival.
articles.title: Rangers midfielder Todd Cantwell unrepentant over Celtic water-bottle incident

articles.author: Alan Pattullo
articles.description: Ange Posteocoglou insists he can’t get hung up on Rangers’ failure to grant Celtic a guard of honour at Ibrox because he regards such gestures as superficial in any case.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou on Rangers guard of honour debate as he details text messages from managers

articles.author: Alan Pattullo
articles.description: Victory over Hearts last weekend precluded the possibility of Celtic securing the title at Ibrox on Saturday afternoon.
articles.title: 'Packed bags last year': Celtic boss on Rangers psychological warfare and how he 'took a moment' after title

articles.description: IT was a goal fit to grace any game, and one that ultimately saw Jota win the PFA Scotland Goal of the Season Award.

articles.description: Second-half goals from Chris Eadie and Findlay Curtis were enough to secure a 2-0 victory over their rivals during the showdown.

articles.description: Caley Thistle will take on Ange Postecoglou's side on Saturday, June 3 at Hampden to fight it out for the final silverware of the campaign.

articles.description: Two rounds of fixtures to go, starting today, and an unprecedented three sides can win the top tier title.

articles.description: Our team give their prediction for the final clash between the Glasgow rivals this season.
articles.title: Rangers vs Celtic predictions from Herald & Times writers

articles.description: ANGE Postecoglou gave short shrift to the notion that having a substantially larger transfer budget than his rival managers had been the sole reason for the success he has enjoyed since moving to this country in the wake of Celtic’s win over Rangers in the Scottish Cup semi-final at Hampden last month.
articles.title: Celtic have outspent Rangers by £50m - Michael Beale needs big money

articles.description: The former Parkhead striker reckons the match is as well not being played - much to the shock of pal McCoist.
articles.title: Sutton stuns McCoist with Rangers vs Celtic 'doesn't matter' claim

articles.description: Aaron Mooy is "touch-and-go" for the fixture at Ibrox.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou provides Celtic injury update ahead of Rangers clash
